issue.title: My proposals for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**UPD: Not updating since 1.1.0 (26 January 2021).**

Good day!

Thank you for your GREAT work!

I have some enhancement requests... Just for a note, maybe. I will update them permanently.

1. ~URLs should become to a corresponding state. On Dataset page, URL is `/projects/4/dataset`. But refreshing the page redirects to `/projects/4` (#595; implemented in #897; see also #992, 976).~
2. ~Pagination, "rows per page" should change URL (#595; also mentioned in #540, #578; implemented in #897). And moreover: every view state should have its own URL.~
3. Put label hints and key shortcut hints back to Annotation page (#635 (merged in non-equivalent #834); mentioned in #509, #627, #776, #991, #1035; see also #829, #834).
4. Show number of imported rows (#1078).
5. Show number of deleting rows only in confirm dialog. It's difficult to delete many rows (#1077).
6. ~Add First/Last pagination links (#615; implemented in #981).~
7. ~IMHO menu should be opened on Project page and/or subpages by default (implementated in #598).~
8. Make limits configurable (#708, #1119, #1124; mentioned in #514 (merged to #521), #575, #706, #853, #1175).
9. Removing rows freezes page. Could it be improved? (#523, #631; implemented in #1115)
10. ~Add importing of Excel and CoNLL files to UI (#650; implemented in #872; mentioned in #847).~
11. Use API error's messages in UI instead of common error messages (#601 (merged in non-equivalent #521)). More concrete importing file's validating errors (mentioned in #521). About login error messages: #910, #739, #911. Other errors: #913, #920, #923, #924, #972, #1052. See also: #485; #521; #150, #157; #651, #723, #23, #1052.
12. ~Use Alpine versions of ~Nginx,~ Node and Python (Docker)? (declined in #659 but then implemented in #795 and partially reversed in #1110; maybe a bad idea, see:  docker-library/docs#904, pypa/manylinux#37; see also #794, #1112).~
13. ~Localize roles and document types in UI (#605; mentioned in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/976#issuecomment-692186583; implemented in #976).~
14. ~Current number of documents on annotation page should be updated on each annotation (mentioned in #594; implemented in #897).~
15. ~Show current user name (#604; implemented in #664;  improved by #680).~
16. Implement project edit page (#1080; see also #1114).
17. ~Allow digits as annotation keys (#599; implemented in #603).~
18. Hide unaccessible abilities from UI (#922; mentioned in #920, #866 (implemented in #916), #920, #924, #927).
19. ~Show import/export labels format (#591; implemented in #651).~
20. ~Allow to import unlabeled datasets (#658; implemented in #861; mentioned in #516, then merged to #521).~
21. ~On Statistics page, show documents per user statistics, also (in addition to labels per user) (#486; implemented in #678).~ See also p.58.
22. ~Make documentation for: superuser's password changing. (#628; implemented in #856; see also #622).~
23. ~On project's subpages, display project's name (#621; implemented in #691).~
24. ~Incorporate API client (https://github.com/afparsons/doccano_api_client, https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/299#issuecomment-557037552; doccano/doccano-client#3).~
25. "Approved" filter (#725, merged to #505, has been merged to #280); #1060.
26. Display user's current role (#881; mentioned in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/758#issuecomment-626325760).
27. Display label `id`s column on Labels page alongside their names (#813, merged to #816).
28. Provide a setting: the order of labels (#816; mentioned in #1028).
29. Import datasets using doccano's exported files (#482; implemented in #958; see also #826, #848, #889, #961, #1015).
30. Implement "view only" role (#413; implemented in #430).
31. Implement dataset import using JSON (#454; implemented in #777).
32. Each annotator sees how many documents are being annotated in the project, by him (#830).
33. For each project, introduce a property: minimal number of annotations (of a given document) to indicate the document as "done" (#831; #947; see also #114).
34. ~Allow annotation approvers to change annotations (#703; implemented in #766).~
35. ~Highlight current page in menu (#833; implemented in #899).~
36. Implement document filters: by labels and annotators (#839 (merged in non-equivalent #280)).
37. Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed, in production (#857; see also #748).
38. Set `-x` and `-e`, `-u` on each Bash script (#860).
39. Get rid of v0.x code (related: #786, #1088)..
40. Document and/or minimize production and development difference (#810; mentioned in #925).
41. Align component versions (#870; implemented in #842). Upgrade component versions.
42. Implement an option: confirmation button on Annotation page (declined in #869; mentioned in #477).
43. Implement label groups (#5, #877 (merged in non-equivalent #477); see also #461, #477, #829, #635, #869).
44. Store label ids and user ids on export (#295; implemented in #889).
45. _Show all removing elements  (dependencies) on confirmation._
46. Project export and import (#901).
47. ~Allow annotator to update/delete other's annotations if annotations are shared (#531, #705; see also #866, #629; implemented in #916).~
48. Show statuses of documents on Dataset page (#928).
49. Implement user creation (declined in #930).
50. Use color in labels selector (on Annotation page) (#829).
51. Implement an option to hide some metadata (#1079).
52. ~Export annotations' timestamps (#963; implemented in #964).~
53. ~Implement: live a comment on a document (https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/966#issuecomment-685565644, #1050; implemented in #1155).~
54. Prebuild Docker images (#971; see also: #786, #1088, #783, #1127, #1231).
55. ~Localize interface (#479; implemented in #976).~
56. "Delete all documents" button (implemented in #979).
57. Implement assigning doccument to an annotator (described in #948, #1063).
58. On Statistics page, show density of users in a label statistics; density of labels in a user statistics (#1076).
59. ~Implement "single class classification" project's option implemented in #489, then re-implemented in #1261; see also #1191, #1236).~
60. Implement users control (#1081).
61. Implement true documents pseudo-random shuffling on dataset annotation (#1113; mentionedin  #1072, https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/1072#discussion_r531214151, #1099).
62. ~Change filename on JSONL export (#851; implemented in #1116).~
63. ~Bulk import for multiple files (#953; implemented in #1163).~
64. Provide using without Internet (#1238).

Doccano ~1.0.2~ ~1.0.3~ ~1.0.4~ ~1.0.5~ 1.1.0.

Thanks!

issue.title: Validation flow seems slow/tedious

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
When selecting a _document_ from my _dataset_, and clicking *annotate*, I am shown a screen with the text and the labels already added (I've added these already, using the API).

Signing off on the entered labels, accepting them means clicking in the left side _checkbox-like icon_. The annoying part here is that, in order to go to the next document I need to go to the top right corner of my screen. This is tedious and slows down the manual validation of annotations. It's actually nicely visible when looking at the _Annotate the dataset_ video featured on the home-screen.

Question here would be if it's possible to have a mechanism that does the acknowledgment _and goes on to the next document_ all within a _single action_. For example using a hot-key and (for mouse-users) a button.

Hope this makes sense.

Your Environment
---------
A fresh clone and docker-compose using the `dev` configuration.

issue.title: [Enhancement request] Use color in labels selector (on Annotation page)

repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
On Annotation page, in labels selector color/background color/text color isn't used.

Proposal: use color in labels selector.

See also: #635 (IMHO it's better option).

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
Feature request:

1. Each label has a group:
2. Labels are visually grouped by their groups on Annotation page (also see #635).
3. There is a checkbox somewhere. If it is checked document: becomes annotated only when each group has a selected a label on Annotation page. Maybe, we could use #869 design here.

issue.title: Group labels by the same color

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
Hi, my sequence labeling is fine-grained, I want to group labels by the same color, where can I find the code to change?

Thanks for the great tool!

body: @icoxfog417 , no, #834 is only a **subset** of this. Moreover, ideas are totally different. This issue proposes to recover historical behavior (and explains, why). That issue proposes to make a little change which doesn't solve problems explained here.

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote  related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show  if someone upvote, and  means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

issue.title: labels disapearing in new UI ?

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

First of all thanks for all of your hard work ! 

I installed doccano using two methods :
 - the simple docker create / docker run 
 - the docker-compose using docker-compose.prod.yml

I'm interested in doing NER so I need to annotate my texts using a lot of labels.

As far as I understand, the docker-compose version is newer than the simple docker one (I haven't had time to look into that yet, could you tell me what triggers an update on the doccano/doccano image on docker hub ?)

The issue I have is that in the docker-compose version I need to select a sentence to see a list of all the annotation since they are not visible onscreen otherwise. But I absolutely need to have a list of annotation visible somewhere on screen for the annotator. Is it a new feature to have a "simpler" design that removes the list of annotation ? Is there a way to add an option to make it visible again ?

Also on the right of the screen there is a "key value" table and I'm not sure what's supposed to be printed here.


Your Environment
---------

*   Operating System: Linux (Centos 7)
*   Python Version Used: 3
*   When you install doccano: docker and docker-compose

issue.title: Tags not shown at top of window

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
I'm evaluating docanno against a number of other tools, I looked at the live demo (https://doccano.herokuapp.com/demo/named-entity-recognition/) and then installed locally. It's working but the UI is different, the live demo has the list of available tags on the top of the page above the document - when I run locally this isn't shown? Is the lice demo an older version - I'm running the latest commit from github? I'm specifically interested in named-entity-recognition.

I can select tags by highlighting a region and sometimes a context menu appears with my tags (but sometimes it doesn't). I can also press one of the keys I bound to each tag - again sometimes it highlights a tag and sometimes it doesn't.

issue.title: What happened to the UI feature to see the labels in 'Text classification' mode?

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hi there,

I have used Doccano before this new UI and I thought it was very handy to have the labels for text classification easy to see, but with the new UI one has to open the field of labels to select. It is still possible to have labels easy to see with some configuration or this feature was dropped? Below two prints to illustrate what I mean. 

![Screenshot_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13541251/109152796-43a51e00-776c-11eb-9a02-3138cb43efce.png)
![Screenshot_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13541251/109152800-443db480-776c-11eb-873f-fc2a0c3a6ad5.png)
